com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.cognito.internal.storage

Interface LocalStorage

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SQLiteLocalStorage

    public interface LocalStorage
    The interface of local storage of Dataset.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeIdentityId(java.lang.String oldIdentityId, java.lang.String newIdentityId)
      Reparent all datasets from old identity id to a new one.
      void conditionallyPutRecords(java.lang.String identityId, java.lang.String datasetName, java.util.List<Record> records, java.util.List<Record> localRecords)
      Puts a list of raw records into thet dataset if the local version hasn't changed (to be used in synchronizations).
      void deleteDataset(java.lang.String identityId, java.lang.String datasetName)
      Deletes a dataset.
      DatasetMetadata getDatasetMetadata(java.lang.String identityId, java.lang.String datasetName)
      Retrieves the metadata of a dataset.
      java.util.List<DatasetMetadata> getDatasets(java.lang.String identityId)
      Gets a list of datasets.
      long getLastSyncCount(java.lang.String identityId, java.lang.String datasetName)
      Retrieves the last sync count.
      java.util.List<Record> getModifiedRecords(java.lang.String identityId, java.lang.String datasetName)
      Retrieves a list of locally modified records since last successful sync operation.
      Record getRecord(java.lang.String identityId, java.lang.String datasetName, java.lang.String key)
      Gets a raw record from local store.
      java.util.List<Record> getRecords(java.lang.String identityId, java.lang.String datasetName)
      Gets a list of all records.
      java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String identityId, java.lang.String datasetName, java.lang.String key)
      Retrieves the string value of a key in dataset.

      Retrieves a key-value map from dataset, excluding marked as deleted values.
      void purgeDataset(java.lang.String identityId, java.lang.String datasetName)
      This is different from #deleteDataset(String).
      void putAllValues(java.lang.String identityId, java.lang.String datasetName, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> values)
      Puts a key-value map into a dataset.

      Puts a list of raw records into dataset.

      Updates the last sync count after successful sync with the remote data store.

      Wipes all locally cached data including dataset metadata and records.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String identityId,
                          java.lang.String datasetName,
                          java.lang.String key)
        Retrieves the string value of a key in dataset. The value can be null when the record doesn't exist or is marked as deleted.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - dataset name
        key - key of the record
        Returns:
        string value of the record, or null if not present or deleted.

      • putValue

        void putValue(java.lang.String identityId,
              java.lang.String datasetName,
              java.lang.String key,
              java.lang.String value)
        Puts the value of a key in dataset. If a new value is assigned to the key, the record is marked as dirty. If the value is null, then the record is marked as deleted. The changed record will be synced with remote storage.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - dataset name
        key - key of the record
        value - string value. If null, the record is marked as deleted.

      • getValueMap

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getValueMap(java.lang.String identityId,
                                                             java.lang.String datasetName)
        Retrieves a key-value map from dataset, excluding marked as deleted values.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        dataset - dataset name
        Returns:
        a key-value map of all but deleted values

      • putAllValues

        void putAllValues(java.lang.String identityId,
                  java.lang.String datasetName,
                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> values)
        Puts a key-value map into a dataset. This is optimized for batch operation. It's the preferred way to put a list of records into dataset.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - dataset name
        values - a key-value map

      • getRecord

        Record getRecord(java.lang.String identityId,
                 java.lang.String datasetName,
                 java.lang.String key)
        Gets a raw record from local store. If the dataset/key combo doesn't exist, null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - dataset name
        key - key of the record
        Returns:
        a Record object if found, null otherwise.

      • getRecords

        java.util.List<Record> getRecords(java.lang.String identityId,
                                  java.lang.String datasetName)
        Gets a list of all records.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - the dataset name
        Returns:
        A list of records which have been updated since lastSyncCount.

      • getModifiedRecords

        java.util.List<Record> getModifiedRecords(java.lang.String identityId,
                                          java.lang.String datasetName)
        Retrieves a list of locally modified records since last successful sync operation.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - dataset name
        Returns:
        a list of locally modified records

      • putRecords

        void putRecords(java.lang.String identityId,
                java.lang.String datasetName,
                java.util.List<Record> records)
        Puts a list of raw records into dataset.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - dataset name
        records - a list of records

      • conditionallyPutRecords

        void conditionallyPutRecords(java.lang.String identityId,
                             java.lang.String datasetName,
                             java.util.List<Record> records,
                             java.util.List<Record> localRecords)
        Puts a list of raw records into thet dataset if the local version hasn't changed (to be used in synchronizations).
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - dataset name
        records - a list of records to conditionally put
        localRecords - a list of records to check for changes

      • getDatasets

        java.util.List<DatasetMetadata> getDatasets(java.lang.String identityId)
                                     throws DataStorageException
        Gets a list of datasets.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        Returns:
        a list of dataset metadata
        Throws:
        DataStorageException

      • deleteDataset

        void deleteDataset(java.lang.String identityId,
                   java.lang.String datasetName)
            throws DatasetNotFoundException
        Deletes a dataset. It clears all records in this dataset and marked it as deleted for future sync. It's still visible in #getDatasets()
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - non empty dataset name
        Throws:
        DatasetNotFoundException

      • purgeDataset

        void purgeDataset(java.lang.String identityId,
                  java.lang.String datasetName)
        This is different from #deleteDataset(String). Not only does it clears all records in the dataset, it also remove it from metadata table. It won't be visible in #getDatasets().
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - non empty dataset name

      • getDatasetMetadata

        DatasetMetadata getDatasetMetadata(java.lang.String identityId,
                                   java.lang.String datasetName)
                            throws DataStorageException
        Retrieves the metadata of a dataset.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - dataset name
        Returns:
        the corresponding metadata
        Throws:
        DataStorageException

      • getLastSyncCount

        long getLastSyncCount(java.lang.String identityId,
                      java.lang.String datasetName)
        Retrieves the last sync count. This sync count is a counter that represents when the last sync happened. The counter should be updated on a successful sync.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - dataset name
        Returns:
        last sync count.

      • updateLastSyncCount

        void updateLastSyncCount(java.lang.String identityId,
                         java.lang.String datasetName,
                         long lastSyncCount)
        Updates the last sync count after successful sync with the remote data store.
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetName - dataset name
        lastSyncCount - new last sync count value

      • wipeData

        void wipeData()
        Wipes all locally cached data including dataset metadata and records. All opened dataset handler should not perform further operations to avoid inconsistent state.

      • changeIdentityId

        void changeIdentityId(java.lang.String oldIdentityId,
                      java.lang.String newIdentityId)
        Reparent all datasets from old identity id to a new one.
        Parameters:
        oldIdentityId - old identity id
        newIdentityId - new identity id

      • updateDatasetMetadata

        void updateDatasetMetadata(java.lang.String identityId,
                           java.util.List<DatasetMetadata> datasetMetadata)
        Updates local dataset metadata
        Parameters:
        identityId - identity id
        datasetMetadata - a list of metadata to update
